text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so I just 
came back from Thailand recently and needless to

say it was a very indulgent trip in terms of food 
and eating and so when I got back I was really

looking for something that's light and healthy 
and easy delicious to make and this my friends

is the recipe you have to try I am calling this 
tao hu neung song kreung now tao hu means tofu neung

means to steam and song kreung is sort of a word 
that doesn't mean much but when added onto food

names it implies that it's got lots of ingredients 
on it like it's a version that's more complex

than a plainer one sort of like a Deluxe burger 
something like that so it's super easy and so good

and vegetarian as well let's get started so tofu 
offers a great soft texture but not a whole lot of

flavor so everything lies in the sauce which this 
is an awesome sauce I've got some Thai mushroom

soy sauce in here but you can use any other kind 
of soy sauce and to this I am adding spazio or

fermented soybean paste and it comes in a bottle 
just like this you can use some miso paste instead

you just need to use a little bit less of it I'm 
also going to add some Chinese cooking wine now

Chinese cooking wine is widely available at Asian 
grocery stores this is the bottle that I use looks

like this doesn't have to be this brand this one's 
a salted so it is a little bit salty it's got the

same smell as satay does it's really subtle now to 
this we've got lots of salty going on I'm going to

add some brown sugar to balance that out I'm going 
to give it a stir I've got some grated garlic you

want finely finely grated or finely minced with 
a knife that works too and then some ground

white pepper for a little heat and I'm going to be 
generous with this and that's it that's all there

is to it so easy so for this recipe you want soft 
tofu okay you one that creamy sort of pudding-like

texture it's going to go really well with all of 
our vegetables and to get it out I just want to

peel this off first and sometimes this happens 
and it's really annoying so you start with the

different side and hopefully the whole thing 
comes off now you're going to see some water

floating around and I just pour that off we no 
big deal there isn't too much on there and then

I use a sharp knife and I want to run it along the 
sides of the container make sure you reach all the

edges and corners there you go and then you hope 
that it comes out in one piece you have to do like

a little bit of squeezing because yeah all right 
don't worry about the little imperfections around

the edges we'll put some good stuff on that and 
you won't see it oh by the way you want a nice

deep plate because we're going to be pouring a 
sauce on it and you want a heat-resistant plate

as well because this is going into the steamer 
okay so on this tofu what I'm going to add is

some julienned ginger and I'm going to spread 
it all over the top and this serves a flavor

and also mechanical purpose which you'll see 
in a minute all right so I'm going to set this

aside for now and show you my vegetables I've got 
here lots of really colorful julienned vegetables

we can change it up if you'd like I've got some 
bell pepper some julienned carrots which I keep

covered so it didn't dry out and also some fresh 
shiitake mushrooms so you want to get the fresh

one not the dried one for this and I just want to 
show you when I cut it I cut off the stem because

the stem tends to be tough and then you want thin 
slices but thicker than you want it to be at the

end because when this cooks it will shrink quite 
a bit just like that all right so I'm going to

start by sauteing my vegetables really quickly so 
I've got a wok here with a little bit of oil and

then I want to sear my mushrooms first I want 
to get some browning on the mushrooms and the

mushrooms will absorb all that while like a sponge 
don't worry that is completely normal so I'm going

to spread it out so they're not sitting on top of 
each other I hate doing this lighter we just it's

so tedious but it's got to be done for maximum 
browning okay and if they curl up you can go

and like press them down and you can smell it when 
they start to brown okay and then you there you go

and then you just toss them and hopefully most of 
them flip so the other side can sear but I'm not

too worried about the other side as long as I can 
get once I've seared that's enough flavor from you

look at that golden color now the vegetables the 
rest of the vegetables go in so carrots and bell

pepper and I'm just going to add a little splash 
of the sauce that we made so the vegetables get

a chance to be seasoned hmmmm and you want to 
cook this just until the vegetables are wilted

the mushrooms look sort of translucent all the way 
through because this is not getting steamed with

the tofu or putting this on top and that looks 
good to me I'm going to turn this off as just

a pinch of my green onions give it a quick stir 
and there's that I've got my steamer preheated on

a rolling boil I got my tofu right here now I'm 
going to pour the sauce over the tofu and then

you'll notice that the ginger acts like a trap so 
that all the sauces can go running off the tofu

yeah there we go now it's really simple I'm going 
to steam the tofu just like this for seven to ten

minutes just to get it nice and hot okay you want 
to make sure the water is boiling close it and see

you later the moments we were all waiting for ha 
yay and yes I know some of you are thinking oh my

god there's so much water in it now and it's going 
to be all diluted well that was exactly the plan

because the sauce as we made it was actually way 
too salty if you're just going to eat it straight

up the plan was that by the time the condensation 
everything mixes it it'll taste just fine it's

worked perfectly for me every time but if you 
are making it for the first time you can give

this taste and then you can adjust the sauce right 
here now we're not done yet the vegetables right

now get placed on top and around the tofu look at 
that look how pretty that is hmm so I like to put

the rest spread around so colorful and too short I 
can't really see what I'm doing here I'm not quite

done yet the remaining green onions I'm going 
to pile that on you want a lot of green onions

for this spread a few around the sides and you 
get some green but you want it mostly on top and

then I'm going to close the steamer with the heat 
off just for another 30 seconds or so to wilt the

green onions and also to distribute that green 
onions flavor throughout the final reveal oh

and you can see that the green onions look even 
brighter in color that's exactly what we're going

for all right now I just got to get some rice to 
go with it oh yes with some hot jasmine rice and

I just love the texture of soft tofu you want to 
get some sauce pour all over that and I can smell

the Chinese wine and ginger oh I love the texture 
of soft tofu it's like warm and custardy and just

sort of dissolves in your mouth the mushrooms 
got a bit too so that's a nice contrast it's

a little salty a little sweet with some heat 
coming from the pepper and the ginger wow that

is so good if you know someone that doesn't like 
tofu and I think we all know somebody my Kobuk

start them out with this and it will blow away 
any preconceived notions they had about totals

this is just delicious so I hope you give it 
a try the recipe has a way to beyond Hawkeye

system calm when you make it send me a photo on 
Facebook Twitter or Instagram and if you haven't

subscribe to the show be soon so right here and 
I will see you next time for your next visit
